original: chos thams cad nges par rtogs pas rdo rje lta bu rnams su 'gyur ba dang / mthu brtan pas ri lta bu rnams su 'gyur ba dang / mi g-yo bas brtan pa'i chos can rnams su 'gyur ba dang / legs par gnas pas sgo'i them pa lta bu rnams su 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: chos thams cad nges par rtogs pas rdo rje lta bu rnams su 'gyur ba dang / mthu brtan pas ri lta bu rnams su 'gyur ba dang / mi g-yo bas brtan pa'i chos can rnams su 'gyur ba dang / legs par gnas pas sgo'i them pa lta bu rnams su 'gyur ba dang /
translated: They become like a vajra, realizing all phenomena; like a mountain, their power is firm; like the Dharma, they are unshakable; like a doorsill, they are well established; and like a lion, they are fearless.

original: sems las su rung bas byi la'i pags pa lta bu rnams su 'gyur ba dang / bya ltar gang dang gang du 'dod par 'gro bas yongs su 'dzin pa ma mchis pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang / gdol bu lta bur nga rgyal bcag pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: sems las su rung bas byi la'i pags pa lta bu rnams su 'gyur ba dang / bya ltar gang dang gang du 'dod par 'gro bas yongs su 'dzin pa ma mchis pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang / gdol bu lta bur nga rgyal bcag pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang /
translated: They will be flexible like a cat’s fur, and they will be able to go wherever they wish, like a bird, without being held back.

original: grong dang / grong khyer dang / grong rdal dang / yul 'khor dang / pho brang 'khor la mngon par dga' ba mi skyed pa dang / ri dvags dang / spre'u dang mtshungs pas dgon pa la mngon par dga' ba rnams su 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: grong dang / grong khyer dang / grong rdal dang / yul 'khor dang / pho brang 'khor la mngon par dga' ba mi skyed pa dang / ri dvags dang / spre'u dang mtshungs pas dgon pa la mngon par dga' ba rnams su 'gyur ba dang /
translated: They will have no attachment to towns, cities, villages, countries, or palaces, and they will be like deer or monkeys, delighting in the wilderness.

original: @8b khyim pa dang / rab tu byung ba rnams dang lhan cig tu mi sten pas ma 'dres pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang / tshogs yongs su sdud pas tshogs kyi ston pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang / sems can thams cad kyis mi bskyod pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang /

translated: They will not associate with householders or renunciants, and they will be leaders of the saṅgha, unshakable to all sentient beings.

original: bdud thams cad kyis gdul dka' ba rnams su 'gyur ba dang / chos thams cad shin tu nges par shes pas so so yang dag par rig pa thob pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang /

translated: They become those who are heedful, with a great deal of joy from the power of the Dharma, and with a gentle attitude. They become those with a vast superior intention, through their work of making offerings and paying respect to all the buddhas.

original: rgyan gyis brgyan pa rnams dag pas lhag pa'i bsam pa dge ba rnams su 'gyur ba dang / rdzun dang khod khro ba'i skyon spangs pas lhag pa'i bsam pa bzang po rnams su 'gyur ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi snang ba thob pas lhag pa'i bsam pa @9a *//

translated: They become those with various superior aspirations, through their accomplishment of various roots of virtue. original: yongs su dag pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang / sems dang zhing tha ba med la shes rab rgyas pa yongs su bzung bas yid bde ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad rgyan gyis brgyan pa rnam par dag pas bkod pa chen po la spyad pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: yongs su dag pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang / sems dang zhing tha ba med la shes rab rgyas pa yongs su bzung bas yid bde ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad rgyan gyis brgyan pa rnam par dag pas bkod pa chen po la spyad pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang /
translated: the completely pure intention of the great array of the purification of the adornment of all world systems,🔽the completely pure intention of the completely pure morality free from the mental activity of the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha,🔽the completely pure intention of the firm commitment of accomplishing all that has been begun,

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sems yid la bgyi ba dang bral bas tshul khrims yongs su dag pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang / brtsams pa thams cad nyams su lon pas yi dam la brtan pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang / sems can thams cad dge ba'i chos rjes su spyod pa'i sngon du 'gro ba rnams su 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sems yid la bgyi ba dang bral bas tshul khrims yongs su dag pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang / brtsams pa thams cad nyams su lon pas yi dam la brtan pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang / sems can thams cad dge ba'i chos rjes su spyod pa'i sngon du 'gro ba rnams su 'gyur ba dang /
translated: the completely pure intention of being the forerunner of all sentient beings in the practice of virtue,

original: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi bslab pa rnams dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la yongs su mi 'jigs pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la phyir mi ldog pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang / bdud dang mu stegs can gzhan dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi bslab pa rnams dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la yongs su mi 'jigs pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la phyir mi ldog pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang / bdud dang mu stegs can gzhan dang /
translated: They will become fearless with regard to all the bodhisattvas’ trainings and perfections, they will become irreversible from all the buddhas’ qualities, they will become invincible to all the māras, tīrthikas, and opponents,

original: phas kyi rgol ba thams cad kyis zil gyis mi non pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang / yid la byed pa rnams sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la gzhog pas chos thams cad la mos pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad la phar 'du shes pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: phas kyi rgol ba thams cad kyis zil gyis mi non pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang / yid la byed pa rnams sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la gzhog pas chos thams cad la mos pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad la phar 'du shes pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang /
translated: they will become devoted to all phenomena by directing their attention to the buddhas’ qualities, they will become those who perceive all buddhas as their fathers,

original: chos thams cad la snang ba skyes pas sangs rgyas thams cad kyis byin gyis brlabs pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang / @9b sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad mngon du gyur pas shes pa sgrib pa med pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang / chos thams cad la rlom sems med pas sgyu ma'i skyes bu rnams su 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: chos thams cad la snang ba skyes pas sangs rgyas thams cad kyis byin gyis brlabs pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang / @9b sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad mngon du gyur pas shes pa sgrib pa med pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang / chos thams cad la rlom sems med pas sgyu ma'i skyes bu rnams su 'gyur ba dang /
translated: They will be those who are blessed by all the buddhas because they have given rise to the light of all phenomena, those who have unobstructed knowledge because they have actualized all the qualities of the buddhas, and those who are like illusory beings because they are free of any conceit about phenomena.

original: ma skyes ma 'ongs shing 'gro ba med pa'i chos dang ldan pas sprul pa lta bu rnams su 'gyur ba dang / dus gsum la rtog pas rmi lam lta bu rnams su 'gyur ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du rang gi lus yang dag par ston pas gzugs brnyan lta bu rnams su 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: ma skyes ma 'ongs shing 'gro ba med pa'i chos dang ldan pas sprul pa lta bu rnams su 'gyur ba dang / dus gsum la rtog pas rmi lam lta bu rnams su 'gyur ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du rang gi lus yang dag par ston pas gzugs brnyan lta bu rnams su 'gyur ba dang /
translated: They will be like emanations because they possess the quality of not being born, not coming, and not going, like dreams because they understand the three times, like reflections because they manifest their bodies in all world systems, like echoes because they have the quality of being beyond words, and like optical illusions because they have the quality of being beyond the eye’s perception.

original: 'pho ba med cing mi gnas la rten pa med pa'i chos can pas brag ca lta bu rnams su 'gyur ba dang / 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba thams cad la grib ma lta bu rnams su 'gyur ba dang / dngos po'i 'du shes spangs pas dngos po med par shes pa la gnas pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang /

translated: They will be like shadows, because they are free from the perception of entities and abide in the knowledge of non-entities.🔽They will be free from the characteristics of the two, because they are free from the practice of the two.🔽They will reach the end of the realm of phenomena, because their bodhicitta is immeasurable.

translated: they will be tireless in teaching the Dharma;

original: sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong ba la gnas pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang / sgyu med pas g-yo med pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang / 'jig rten thams cad kyi sgron mar gyur pas drang po rnams su 'gyur ba dang / khams gsum thams cad na tshad med pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong ba la gnas pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang / sgyu med pas g-yo med pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang / 'jig rten thams cad kyi sgron mar gyur pas drang po rnams su 'gyur ba dang / khams gsum thams cad na tshad med pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang /
translated: They will be those who never abandon any sentient being. They will be those who are without deceit, being free of pretense. They will be those who are upright, being the lamps for the whole world. They will be those who are immeasurable, being beyond the three realms.

original: tha snyad tsam du rnam par dpyod pas nyon mongs pa med pa la gnas pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang / gzhi med pa la dga' bas ma 'dres par gnas pa @10b rnams su 'gyur ba dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i chos can pas yang dag pa'i mtha' la gnas pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: tha snyad tsam du rnam par dpyod pas nyon mongs pa med pa la gnas pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang / gzhi med pa la dga' bas ma 'dres par gnas pa @10b rnams su 'gyur ba dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i chos can pas yang dag pa'i mtha' la gnas pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang /
translated: They will be those who are without afflictions, being free of conceptual elaboration. They will be those who are unadulterated, delighting in the absence of any basis. They will be those who abide in the limit of reality, being free of conceptual elaboration.

original: theg pa chen po la sems can thams cad gzhog pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i gtam yang dag par ston pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang / 'jigs shing spu zing zhes byed pa thams cad dang bral bas mi 'jigs pa thob pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: theg pa chen po la sems can thams cad gzhog pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i gtam yang dag par ston pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang / 'jigs shing spu zing zhes byed pa thams cad dang bral bas mi 'jigs pa thob pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang /
translated: They will be those who have attained fearlessness, free from all fear and terror.🔽They will be those who are skilled in the intention of the Thus-Gone One with regard to all the sūtras and Dharma discourses.🔽They will be those who show their faces to all assemblies.

original: mdo sde'i chos kyi rnam grangs thams cad la de bzhin gshegs pa'i dgongs te gsungs pa la mkhas pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang / 'khor thams cad kyi nang du nye bar 'gro bas bzhin kun tu ston pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang / theg pa chen po la 'jig rten thams cad kyis mchod cing thams cad mkhyen pa ltar bsod nams kyi bdag po rnams su 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: mdo sde'i chos kyi rnam grangs thams cad la de bzhin gshegs pa'i dgongs te gsungs pa la mkhas pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang / 'khor thams cad kyi nang du nye bar 'gro bas bzhin kun tu ston pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang / theg pa chen po la 'jig rten thams cad kyis mchod cing thams cad mkhyen pa ltar bsod nams kyi bdag po rnams su 'gyur ba dang /
translated: They will be those who are worshipped by all worlds in the Great Vehicle and who are the lords of merit as if they were omniscient.

original: 'jig rten pa thams cad kyi sbyin gnas su gyur pas yon tan zad mi shes pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhabs kyi drung du dga' ba dang / dad pa chen po rab tu rnyed pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa thams cad kyi sbyin gnas su gyur pas yon tan zad mi shes pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhabs kyi drung du dga' ba dang / dad pa chen po rab tu rnyed pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang /
translated: They will find great joy and faith in the presence of the Thus-Gone One.🔽They will be virtuous and eloquent in their inquiries about the teachings of the Buddha.🔽They will be fearless in the midst of assemblies, and so their minds will be free from anxiety.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su dri ba la dge ba'i spobs pa can rnams su 'gyur ba dang / 'khor gyi nang du 'jigs shing bag tsha ba spangs pas yid spa mi 'gong ba rnams su 'gyur ba dang / phas kyi rgol ba thams cad tshar gcod pas smra ba'i stag lta bu rnams su 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su dri ba la dge ba'i spobs pa can rnams su 'gyur ba dang / 'khor gyi nang du 'jigs shing bag tsha ba spangs pas yid spa mi 'gong ba rnams su 'gyur ba dang / phas kyi rgol ba thams cad tshar gcod pas smra ba'i stag lta bu rnams su 'gyur ba dang /
translated: They will be like tigers in their eloquence, for they will defeat all opponents.

translated: They will be like lions in their eloquence, for they will crush all opposing positions.

original: ma nyams pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyis gnang bas chos kyi 'bel ba'i gtam gtan la 'bengs pa'i phyir sengge'i sgra sgrog cing sengge'i khri la 'dug pa mang ba rnams su 'gyur ba dang / yang dag par brjod pa la 'jug pa thams cad rab tu rtog pas 'jig rten rgyang pan pa thams cad ma bstan pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: ma nyams pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyis gnang bas chos kyi 'bel ba'i gtam gtan la 'bengs pa'i phyir sengge'i sgra sgrog cing sengge'i khri la 'dug pa mang ba rnams su 'gyur ba dang / yang dag par brjod pa la 'jug pa thams cad rab tu rtog pas 'jig rten rgyang pan pa thams cad ma bstan pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang /
translated: They will be places where the Dharma is not in decline, where the Dharma is taught in accordance with the permission of all the buddhas, where the lion’s roar is proclaimed, and where many sit on lion thrones.🔽They will be places where the Dharma is taught without the need for any instruction from the tīrthikas, because they will have realized all the ways of expressing the Dharma.

original: sangs rgyas su 'gyur ba'i rgyu la gnas pas dam pa'i chos smra ba rnams su 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhabs 'bring bgyid pas chos 'dod pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsnyen bkur bgyid pa la mi skyo ba rnams su 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas su 'gyur ba'i rgyu la gnas pas dam pa'i chos smra ba rnams su 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhabs 'bring bgyid pas chos 'dod pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsnyen bkur bgyid pa la mi skyo ba rnams su 'gyur ba dang /
translated: They will be places where the Dharma is taught by those who are the cause of buddhahood, where those who wish for the Dharma will be the servants of the Thus-Gone One, and where those who are not weary of serving spiritual friends will be present.

original: phyogs bcur rnam par rgyu bas gnas ma mchis pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang / sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bgyid pa'i smon lam 'debs pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang / rin po che'i mchog la ngal sos par bgyid pa la mkhas pas chos kyi rgya mtshor zhugs pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: phyogs bcur rnam par rgyu bas gnas ma mchis pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang / sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bgyid pa'i smon lam 'debs pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang / rin po che'i mchog la ngal sos par bgyid pa la mkhas pas chos kyi rgya mtshor zhugs pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang /
translated: they will be those who do not remain in any of the ten directions; they will be those who make aspirations to ripen all sentient beings; they will be those who, through skill in resting in the supreme jewel, enter the ocean of the Dharma;

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad rnam pa sna tshogs kyis brgyan pas 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad mi g-yo ba rnams su 'gyur ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi cho 'phrul gyis rnam par rol pa spyod pas cho 'phrul chen po myong ba rnams su 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad rnam pa sna tshogs kyis brgyan pas 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad mi g-yo ba rnams su 'gyur ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi cho 'phrul gyis rnam par rol pa spyod pas cho 'phrul chen po myong ba rnams su 'gyur ba dang /
translated: they will be those who, through adorning all world systems in various ways, do not move from all world systems; they will be those who, through engaging in the display of the miracles of the buddhas, experience great miracles;

original: sangs rgyas blta ba sems kyi skad cig gcig la rag las pa rnams su 'gyur @11b ba dang / chos la gus pa rnyed pas ye shes kyis bskor ba rnams su 'gyur ba dang / chos kyi sku dang 'dra bar rtogs pas nam mkha' lta bu rnams su 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas blta ba sems kyi skad cig gcig la rag las pa rnams su 'gyur @11b ba dang / chos la gus pa rnyed pas ye shes kyis bskor ba rnams su 'gyur ba dang / chos kyi sku dang 'dra bar rtogs pas nam mkha' lta bu rnams su 'gyur ba dang /
translated: they will be those who are dependent on a single instant of mind to see the Buddha; they will be those who, having gained respect for the Dharma, are surrounded by pristine awareness; they will be those who, realizing the Dharma body, are like space;

original: sangs rgyas kyi gdung mi chad par bgyid pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams la yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad rgyun mi gcod pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang / legs par gnas shing myur ba'i cad shes pas go cha chen po bgos pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gdung mi chad par bgyid pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams la yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad rgyun mi gcod pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang / legs par gnas shing myur ba'i cad shes pas go cha chen po bgos pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang /
translated: they will be those who, in order to ensure that the lineage of the Buddha is not broken, cause the bodhisattvas to take it up; they will be those who do not interrupt any of the bodhisattva activities; they will be those who, being well established and having swift understanding, are clad in the great armor;

original: de bzhin gshegs pa stobs bcu'i sa la thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du dbang bskur bas dbang bskur ba rnams su 'gyur ba dang / bgrang ba'i tshul gyis cho ga shes pas 'du shes kyi rnam pa thams cad rab tu rtogs pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa stobs bcu'i sa la thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du dbang bskur bas dbang bskur ba rnams su 'gyur ba dang / bgrang ba'i tshul gyis cho ga shes pas 'du shes kyi rnam pa thams cad rab tu rtogs pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang /
translated: They will be those who are consecrated with the consecration of omniscience on the level of the ten powers of the thus-gone ones.🔽They will be those who, through the knowledge of ritual through the method of counting, fully realize all aspects of perception.🔽They will be those who, through the realization of all aspects of counting, are skilled in all that is destroyed and created.

original: grangs kyi rnam pa thams cad nye bar rtogs pas 'jig pa dang / 'chags pa thams cad la mkhas pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang / gtong ba thams cad la nan tan bgyid pas mi gnas shing len pa ma mchis pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: grangs kyi rnam pa thams cad nye bar rtogs pas 'jig pa dang / 'chags pa thams cad la mkhas pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang / gtong ba thams cad la nan tan bgyid pas mi gnas shing len pa ma mchis pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang /
translated: They will be those who, through their practice of all forms of giving, are without abode and without grasping.

original: 'gyong pa med pa'i sbyin bdag chen por gyur pas gtong ba la mkhas pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang / srid pa'i 'gro ba thams cad kyi skye ba'i gnas rnams don du mi gnyer ba rnams su 'gyur ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan na bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing dag mthong zhing chos kyang nyan la /
analyzed: 'gyong pa med pa'i sbyin bdag chen por gyur pas gtong ba la mkhas pa rnams su 'gyur ba dang / srid pa'i 'gro ba thams cad kyi skye ba'i gnas rnams don du mi gnyer ba rnams su 'gyur ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan na bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing dag mthong zhing chos kyang nyan la /
translated: They will see the buddha realms of the blessed buddhas dwelling in other world systems and hear the Dharma.

original: de'ang 'dzin cing mi bskyud @12a *//
analyzed: de'ang 'dzin cing mi bskyud @12a *//
translated: They will retain it and not forget it.

original: la lnga mngon par shes pa'ang ma lags /
analyzed: la lnga mngon par shes pa'ang ma lags /
translated: They will not have the five superknowledges,

original: drug mngon par shes pa'ang ma lags shing /
analyzed: drug mngon par shes pa'ang ma lags shing /
translated: nor will they have the six superknowledges.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de rnams 'jig rten gyi khams de nas shi 'phos te sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag na gnas pa'ang ma lags la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de rnams 'jig rten gyi khams de nas shi 'phos te sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag na gnas pa'ang ma lags la /
translated: Those bodhisattvas will not die and transmigrate from that world system and then dwell in those buddha realms.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de rnams 'jig rten gyi khams 'di nyid na gnas bzhin du sangs rgyas rnams kyang mthong la chos kyang nyan cing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de rnams 'jig rten gyi khams 'di nyid na gnas bzhin du sangs rgyas rnams kyang mthong la chos kyang nyan cing /

original: de thams cad kyang kun tu 'dzin te /
analyzed: de thams cad kyang kun tu 'dzin te /
translated: They retain it all.

original: ji ltar bdag da ltar bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan snga na mchis pa bzhin du the tshom dang / nem nur ma mchis pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag da ltar bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan snga na mchis pa bzhin du the tshom dang / nem nur ma mchis pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as I am now in the presence of the Blessed One, without any doubt or hesitation,

original: byang chub sems dpa' de rnams kyang tha na rmi lam na'ang sangs rgyas mthong zhing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de rnams kyang tha na rmi lam na'ang sangs rgyas mthong zhing /

analyzed: chos nyan pa dang mi 'bral ba rnams su 'gyur ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang lags /

analyzed: bzang skyong gis zhus pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi le'u ste dang po'o ////

analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bzang skyong la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //

analyzed: khyod skye bo mang po la phan pa dang / skye bo med po la bde ba dang / 'jig rten la snying brtse ba dang / skye bo phal po che dang / lha dang / mi rnams kyi don dang / phan pa dang bde pa'i phyir zhugs shing /

analyzed: bzang skyong / khyod de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa la don 'di 'dri bar sems pa legs so //

analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad dang mngon sum du gnas pa ste /
translated: He is present in the direct perception of all buddhas.

original: bzang skyong / khyod kyi yon tan brjod na lta mthar ma phyin to //🔽bzang skyong / da ltar gyi sangs rgyas mngon sum du bzhugs @13a *//

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: de bas na /

translated: It will be for the benefit of many people, for the happiness of many people, in compassion for the world, for the welfare, benefit, and happiness of gods, humans, and the multitude of beings.

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bzang skyong la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //

analyzed: rigs kyi bu /

analyzed: zhes lung ston to //

analyzed: de sad pa dang / lus dang lto ma rgyas par gyur nas de 'di snyam du 'di lta ste /

analyzed: rmi lam dang 'dra ba de lta bu'i chos shig yod do snyam ste /

analyzed: bzang skyong / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' khyim pa'am /

original: bzang skyong / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bzang skyong / 'di lta ste /

analyzed: de dag sus kyang ma byas /

analyzed: sus kyang ma bgags te /

analyzed: bzang skyong / 'on kyang dge slong de'i sems rtse gcig pa'i dbang gis mdun na keng rus 'dug pa mthong ngo //

translated: Bhadrapāla, in the same way, the bodhisattvas who are protected by the Buddha and who abide in this meditative absorption, in whatever direction there are Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Beings, in that direction they direct their attention in order to behold the Buddhas.

analyzed: chos kyi sbyin pa la brtson 'grus brtsam par bya'o //
translated: “One should strive in the gift of the Dharma.

original: dran @44b pa nye bar gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: dran @44b pa nye bar gnas par bya'o //

original: dad pa dang ldan par bya'o //
analyzed: dad pa dang ldan par bya'o //

analyzed: des pa dang ngo tsha shes pa dang ldan pa dang / khrel yod pa phun sum tshogs par bya'o //

original: rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa la lhag par ma zhen par bya'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa la lhag par ma zhen par bya'o //

analyzed: ser sna med cing phrag dog med pa dang / sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang / yo byad bsnyungs par bya'o //

analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i gtam don du gnyer bar bya'o //

analyzed: byas pa shes pa dang / byas pa gzo bar bya'o //

original: gus pa dang bcas pa dang / zhes dang bcas par bya'o //
analyzed: gus pa dang bcas pa dang / zhes dang bcas par bya'o //

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni /

analyzed: rnyed par dka' bas slob dpon dang / mkhan po la bsnyen bkur bya bar spro bar bya'o //

analyzed: des su las chos 'di lta bu 'di rnam par thos par 'gyur ba dang / blangs pa dang / glegs bam du bris par 'gyur ba dang / tshig gis ston pa'i rag las par 'gyur ba de dang / gang las mdo sde 'di kun chub par byed pa'am /
translated: You should think of the person from whom you have heard this kind of Dharma, and who has taken it up and written it down, and who has taught it verbally, and who has caused you to understand this sutra,

original: kun chub par byed par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: kun chub par byed par 'gyur ba'am /

analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen du 'du shes bskyed par bya'o //
translated: You should think of him as a spiritual friend.

original: ston par 'du shes bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: ston par 'du shes bskyed par bya'o //

original: chos de lta bu 'di rnams kyi don dang / byang chub yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir des de la lhag par yang dga' ba dang / dang ba dang / gus pa bskyed par @45a *//
analyzed: chos de lta bu 'di rnams kyi don dang / byang chub yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir des de la lhag par yang dga' ba dang / dang ba dang / gus pa bskyed par @45a *//
translated: In order to understand the meaning of this kind of Dharma and to ripen your enlightenment, you should develop a special joy, clarity, and respect for him.

original: bya'o; ;bzang skyong /
analyzed: bya'o; ;bzang skyong /
translated: Bhadrapāla,

analyzed: bzang skyong / byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'am /

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa pa'am /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa pa'am /

analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag chos 'di lta bu kun chub par ma byas pa'i chos rnams kun chub par 'gyur ba dang / kun chub par byas pa'i chos rnams gnas pa dang / chud mi za ba dang /
translated: or to the vehicle of the solitary buddhas, to understand the teachings that they have not yet understood, or to retain, not lose, and not be without the teachings that they have understood.

analyzed: med par mi 'gyur ba ni / gnas ma yin te /

analyzed: skabs med do //

translated: and those monks who teach such Dharma as this, and those who will master such a Dharma discourse as this,

analyzed: kun chub par byas pa dang / glegs bam du bris par gyur pa de dag la dga' ba dang / dang ba dang / gus pa'ang skyed cing /

analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa pa'am /
translated: in the vehicle of the hearers,

analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag kun chub par ma byas pa'i chos rnams kun chub par 'gyur ba dang / kun chub par byas pa'i chos rnams gnas pa dang / chud mi za ba dang / med par mi 'gyur ba'i gnas yin te /

original: de ni / gnas yod do /
analyzed: de ni / gnas yod do /

original: bzang skyong / de bas na /🔽khyod mos par bya'o //
analyzed: bzang skyong / de bas na / khyod mos par bya'o //

analyzed: khyod kyis khong du chud par bya'o //

analyzed: 'di ltar chos 'di lta bu ston pa'i dge slong rnams la dga' ba dang / dang ba dang / gus pa bskyed par bya'o //

analyzed: 'di ni / nga'i rjes su bstan pa yin no; ;bzang skyong /

analyzed: dgon pa la dga' ba dang / dgon pa la gzhal ba dang / dgon pa la 'bab pa dang / dgon pa la bab par bya'o //
translated: He should delight in solitude, be inclined toward solitude, be devoted to solitude, and be intent on solitude.

original: ljongs kyi phyogs la mngon par mi dga' bar bya'o //
analyzed: ljongs kyi phyogs la mngon par mi dga' bar bya'o //
translated: He should not delight in the regions of the country.

original: @46a *// mdza' bo'i khyim dang / zas sbyin pa'i khyim mi 'dod pas srog la mi blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: @46a *// mdza' bo'i khyim dang / zas sbyin pa'i khyim mi 'dod pas srog la mi blta bar bya'o //

analyzed: lus gtong bas lus la mi chags pa dang / dgon pa'i 'du shes thob par bya'o //

analyzed: rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa la mi brten pa dang / dam pa'i chos rab tu gzung bar bya'o //
translated: He should not rely on gain, honor, or praise, and should uphold the sublime Dharma.

analyzed: lhung bzed dang chos gos la mi chags pa dang / mi gsog par bya'o //

analyzed: mgron du gnyer mi dgos par bsod snyoms spyad par bya'o //

analyzed: 'dzem zhing 'gyod pa dang ldan par bya'o //

analyzed: gser bdag gir mi byed par bya'o //

analyzed: kun nas ldang ba med pas 'gyod pa dang bral bar bya'o // khong khro ba spangs pas byams pa la gnas par bya'o //
translated: “One should be free from regret by being free from the arising of afflictions.🔽“One should abide in love by abandoning anger.

original: 'tshe ba spangs pas snying rje la gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: 'tshe ba spangs pas snying rje la gnas par bya'o //
translated: “One should abide in compassion by abandoning harmfulness.

original: mngon par mi dga' ba spangs pas dga' ba la gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: mngon par mi dga' ba spangs pas dga' ba la gnas par bya'o //
translated: “One should abide in joy by abandoning displeasure.

analyzed: mtshan ma thams cad spangs pas btang snyoms la gnas par bya'o //

original: brtson 'grus brtsams pas bslab pa 'dod par bya'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams pas bslab pa 'dod par bya'o //
translated: “One should desire the training by engaging in diligence.

original: rmugs pa dang gnyid kyis mi non par 'chag pa la zhugs par bya'o //
analyzed: rmugs pa dang gnyid kyis mi non par 'chag pa la zhugs par bya'o //
translated: “One should engage in walking meditation without being overcome by dullness and drowsiness.

original: bzang skyong / de pas na /
analyzed: bzang skyong / de pas na /
translated: “Bhadrapāla,

original: byang chub sems dpa' khyim gyi gnas nas byung ba ting nge 'dzin 'di thos nas lung nod pa dang / sgom par 'dod pa des chos de dag la gnas te ting nge 'dzin 'di lung mnod par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' khyim gyi gnas nas byung ba ting nge 'dzin 'di thos nas lung nod pa dang / sgom par 'dod pa des chos de dag la gnas te ting nge 'dzin 'di lung mnod par bya'o //
translated: “Bodhisattvas who have left the household life and who wish to hear, receive the transmission of, and meditate on this samādhi should abide by those dharmas and receive the transmission of this samādhi.

original: bsgom par bya'o //🔽de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bzang @46b skyong gis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bsgom par bya'o // de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bzang @46b skyong gis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: They should meditate on it.

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: ” The bodhisattva mahāsattva Bhadrapāla said to the Bhagavān, “Bhagavān,🔽it is amazing

original: 'di ltar rgya che zhing bzang ba'i chos 'di dag de bzhin gshegs pas bstan cing gsungs pa ni; ngo mtshar to //
analyzed: 'di ltar rgya che zhing bzang ba'i chos 'di dag de bzhin gshegs pas bstan cing gsungs pa ni; ngo mtshar to //
translated: that the Tathāgata has taught and explained these vast and good dharmas.

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /🔽byang chub sems dpa' le lo can gang dag 'byung ba de dag ni /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das / byang chub sems dpa' le lo can gang dag 'byung ba de dag ni /
translated: Bhagavān,🔽there will be lazy bodhisattvas

original: ting nge 'dzin 'di thos nas skrag par 'gyur /🔽dngang bar 'gyur /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin 'di thos nas skrag par 'gyur / dngang bar 'gyur /
translated: who, when they hear this samādhi, will be frightened,🔽terrified,

original: dngang bar bgyid par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngang bar bgyid par 'gyur ro //
translated: and will be terrified of it.

original: chos de lta bur bzang pa de dag 'chad pa la'ang dga' ba dang / mgu ba dang / dang ba rgya chen po mi 'thob cing de dag 'di snyam du bdag cag ni /

translated: They will not be delighted, pleased, or inspired to hear such excellent teachings.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gzhan las ting nge 'dzin 'di bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gzhan las ting nge 'dzin 'di bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: They will think, ‘We should seek this absorption from other thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddhas.

original: da ltar ni /
analyzed: da ltar ni /
translated: We are now

original: bdag cag lus skem zhing nad mang ngo snyam du sems par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bdag cag lus skem zhing nad mang ngo snyam du sems par 'gyur te /
translated: emaciated and sick.’

analyzed: de dag da ltar gyi sangs rgyas mngon sum du bzhugs pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di thos nas zhum par 'gyur /
translated: When they hear this absorption of directly perceiving the present buddhas, they will be discouraged.

original: kun tu zhum par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: kun tu zhum par 'gyur zhing /
translated: They will be utterly discouraged.

analyzed: da ltar gyi sangs rgyas mngon sum du bzhugs pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di sgrub par brtson 'grus kyang mi rtsom par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not strive to accomplish this absorption of directly perceiving the present buddhas.

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Respected Blessed One,

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po brtson 'grus brtsams pa dang / dran pa la gnas pa /🔽chos 'tshal ba /🔽chos la gus pa /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po brtson 'grus brtsams pa dang / dran pa la gnas pa / chos 'tshal ba / chos la gus pa /
translated: “Moreover, Mañjuśrī, there are bodhisattva mahāsattvas who are diligent, who abide in mindfulness,🔽who seek the Dharma,

original: chos 'dzin pa /🔽chos ston pa /
analyzed: chos 'dzin pa / chos ston pa /
translated: who respect the Dharma,🔽who uphold the Dharma,🔽who teach the Dharma,

original: chos smra ba /
analyzed: chos smra ba /

original: de nas srog chags lnga brgya tsam po de dag gis mchi ma phyis nas bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar te pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs nas bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud de bcom ldan 'das
analyzed: de nas srog chags lnga brgya tsam po de dag gis mchi ma phyis nas bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar te pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs nas bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud de bcom ldan 'das
translated: Then, those five hundred living beings wiped away their tears, put their upper robes over one shoulder, and knelt on their right knees, facing the direction of the Blessed One with palms joined in respect.

original: la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: They said this to the Blessed One:

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Venerable Blessed One,

original: bdag cag kyang de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas lo lnga brgya pa tha mar gyur pa /
analyzed: bdag cag kyang de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas lo lnga brgya pa tha mar gyur pa /
translated: we too, in the final five hundred years after the Tathāgata’s parinirvāṇa,

original: phyi ma'i dus phyi ma'i tshe lnga brgya pa tha mar gyur pa na mdo sde 'di lta bu 'di dag gzung bar bgyi'o //

analyzed: bsgom par bgyi'o //
